org.apache.struts2.sitegraph
Class SiteGraph

java.lang.Object
  org.apache.struts2.sitegraph.SiteGraph

public class SiteGraph
extends Object

SiteGraph is a tool that renders out GraphViz-generated images depicting your Struts-powered web application's flow. SiteGraph requires GraphViz be installed and that the "dot" executable be in your command path. You can find GraphViz at http://www.graphviz.org.

If you wish to use SiteGraph through its API rather than through the command line, you can do that as well. All you need to do is create a new SiteGraph instance, optionally specify a Writer to output the dot content to, and then call prepare().

Method Detail

main

public static void main(String[] args)
                 throws IOException
Throws:
IOException

prepare

public void prepare()
Prepares the dot generated content and writes out to the provided writer object. If no writer has been given, that a FileWriter pointing to "out.dot" in the specified output directly shall be used.

render

public void render()
Invokes the dot command, cause GraphViz to render out.dot in the form of out.gif, located in the specified output directory. If an error occurs during this process, the error is logged and the method completes without throwing an exception.

setWriter

public void setWriter(Writer writer)
